Parameters.Name: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Correct response
Test.Description: The DUT sends all correct responses

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Correct response: Some Certificates in GetAllCertificates
Test.Description: The DUT sends all correct responses

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Invalid response: UploadCertificate (wrong key id)
Test.Description: 10. If keyID2 is not equal to keyID1, FAIL the test and go to step 24.

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Invalid response: GetCertificate (wring CertificateID)
Test.Description: 13. If X509Cert1.CertificateID is not equal to certID2, FAIL the test and go to the step 24.

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Invalid response: GetCertificate (wring KeyID)
Test.Description: 14. If X509Cert1.KeyID is not equal to keyID1, FAIL the test and go to the step 24.

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Invalid response: GetCertificate (wring CertificateContent)
Test.Description: 15. ONVIF client validates that X509Cert1.CertificateContent is correctly DER encoded (see Annex A.19). 16. If X509Cert1.CertificateContent is incorrectly DER encoded, FAIL the test and go to the step 24.

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Invalid response: GetCertificate (wring CertificateContent wrong data)
Test.Description: 15. ONVIF client validates that X509Cert1.CertificateContent is correctly DER encoded (see Annex A.19). 16. If X509Cert1.CertificateContent is incorrectly DER encoded, FAIL the test and go to the step 24.

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Invalid response: GetAllCertificates (no requered CertificateID)
Test.Description: 21. If certificateList1 does not contain certificate with Certificate.CertificateID equal to certID2, FAIL the test and go to the step 24.

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Invalid response: GetAllCertificates (no requered CertificateID, empty list)
Test.Description: 21. If certificateList1 does not contain certificate with Certificate.CertificateID equal to certID2, FAIL the test and go to the step 24.

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Invalid response: GetAllCertificates (wrong data - KeyID)
Test.Description: 23. If X509Cert1 is not equal to X509Cert2, FAIL the test and go to the step 24.

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Invalid response: GetAllCertificates (wrong data - Alias)
Test.Description: 23. If X509Cert1 is not equal to X509Cert2, FAIL the test and go to the step 24.

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Invalid response: GetAllCertificates (wrong data - CertificateContent)
Test.Description: 23. If X509Cert1 is not equal to X509Cert2, FAIL the test and go to the step 24.

Test.TestName: ADVANCED_SECURITY-2-1-28 Create PKCS#10 request with PKCS#12
Test.Name: Invalid response: second GetAllCertificates
Test.Description: 26.3. If certificateList2 contains certificate with Certificate.CertificateID equal to certID2, FAIL the test and go to the step 28.
